attributes.comment:
I strongly oppose the fee increase as I believe it will really not help from the
standpoint of speeding up processing of immigration benefits. How long an
applicant has to wait to complete an immigration process depends on
limits/quotas set by current immigration laws and cutoff dates set by state
department? In the context of the huge backlogs in employment based
immigration and lengthy wait times (~6 years), increasing fees for immigration
benefits such as employment authorization/advance parole/adjustment of status
can only cause greater hardship to potential skilled immigrants and make it less
attractive to immigrate to the US.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Sailesh Rao
